summary: The Drake Passage is a body of water between South America and Antarctica, named after Sir Francis Drake. It connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans and is known for its treacherous conditions, with huge waves and strong currents. This passage is crucial for ocean circulation and climate patterns because it's the narrowest point around Antarctica, influencing how water flows and mixes globally. Despite its challenges, many tourist ships navigate this route to reach Antarctica.
title: Drake Passage
